entry.title: The Burnt Out Star
entry.summary: Welcome to the Supernova, or more, "the Burnt Out Star." The supernova occurs when a star is dying, with it's fire inside fading…
entry.content:
Welcome to the Supernova, or more, "the Burnt Out Star." The supernova occurs when a star is dying, with it's fire inside fading and dimming as time passes until it will explode. As you float close to the star, you notice your body feeling heavier. You connect with the star.

Burnout

The feeling of burnout is a common feeling amongst all of us, especially as students. Often times we wonder, "How did I become like this? I was so strongheaded and organized not too long ago, what's wrong with me?" It occurs after a prolonged amount of stress that gets to the point of interfering with our ability to do daily tasks.

Common signs of Burnout are:

As per Malvern Behavioral Health, Jerry Kosmin refers to these signs of burnout:

Sign  
Exhaustion Even with a lot of sleep, you feel as if you can't go about with your day without feeling fatigue.
Lack of Motivation and Interest You feel diminished feelings of doing daily tasks, or things you used to enjoy.
Lack of Creativity and Concentration With fatigue comes a decrease in our creative abilities, leading to prolongued procrastination. You feel unable to feel organized or motivated to do work.
Increased Irritability You get to the point where you get mad at yourself for being incapable of doing what you normally were able to do. It's not your fault, but you feel as it is. 
Frequent Illnesses After prolonged stress and overdoing yourself, your body will start to wear out and tell you it needs a break. Not taking a break and pushing yourself will wear you out even further.

With increased stress is a higher toll on your body, leading to high cortisol (stress hormone) levels, high blood pressure, and ultimately fatigue. Most common factors that contribute to such stress in students is comparing ourselves to other people, immense workloads, neverending deadlines, and feelings of loneliness.  Anxiety is all over your mind, you feel susceptible to be depressed. You can't help but wonder if you're even doing the right thing.

Did you know loneliness is as deadly as smoking 15 cigarettes a day?

There is such a thing as "good stress" and "bad stress"

Stress in itself is not a bad thing. It is a part of our daily lives and what can act as a motivating factor to keep us going. Smaller levels of stress are what allow us to stay focused and feel the need to reach our goals.

Excessive amounts of stress, however, is what can cause a strain on our bodies. Being exposed to too much stress will lead to mental, physical, emotional breakdowns which can lead to burn out. So don't be afraid to experience stress, but don't let stress overtake your entire life.

Strategies to Cope

Strategies  
Go Outside! Get Some Fresh Air Go out for a breather and feel the Vitamin D. Take a walk or go out and exercise so you can keep your body up and going, firing it up. Seeing green every so often can make your mind relax.
Remind Yourself to Take Your Own Pace Go out for a breather and feel the Vitamin D. Take a walk or go out and exercise so you can keep your body up and going, firing it up. Seeing green every so often can make your mind relax.
Reach Out to Your Close Circle Ask for help when you need! Your friends and family are there to support you, and there is no shame in asking for help. Small words of encouragement can spring you back up to action. 

A star dies due to exhausting itself of its hydrogen levels, ultimately not able to fuel itself no longer. With a little bit of extra fire and help from others, maybe the star could be brought back again. Just as you can.

Continue ->

entry.title: The Black Hole
entry.summary: You're floating further and further until you feel something pulling you down. Your body heavy, your body getting pulled in. You look up…
entry.content:
You're floating further and further until you feel something pulling you down. Your body heavy, your body getting pulled in. You look up to notice it's a black hole. A big one. Time seems to slow, you see clocks flying past. You close your eyes and take a deep breathe in. You let it take you in.

Depression

Depression is very common to experience, and it comes with overwhelming thoughts.

Depression has become a common term to refer to prolonged sadness in media, but that in itself may undermine the reality of those who experience depression as a condition. 

Statistics

Data from __ shows that college students experienced __ in 2022. 

Common Strategies to Cope

 

*warning: this is not a method of self diagnoses but a means to inform. to properly diagnose, ask a professional for help.

entry.title: Shooting Stars
entry.summary: You float further and see what seems to be shooting stars. You go closer, only to find that they are actually meteors shooting…
entry.content:
You float further and see what seems to be shooting stars. You go closer, only to find that they are actually meteors shooting across. Each burning, each gaining speed. Your curiousity overtakes you, and you land on top of one of the meteors.

The meteor is burning, it overwhelms you. There's too many around you. All burning up, all gaining speed. You jump off, hoping there aren't more. But it doesn't stop. It just keeps going, shaking up your body.

Anxiety

Anxiety is very common to experience, and it comes with overwhelming thoughts. 

Statistics

Statistics show that college students experienced in 2022. 

Common Strategies to Cope

entry.title: Welcome to Floating
entry.summary: As you float across time and space, you'll come across different obstacles. Each obstacle will bring different feelings. Each a common entity amongst…
entry.content:
As you float across time and space, you'll come across different obstacles. Each obstacle will bring different feelings. Each a common entity amongst all of us. Venture into each and see where you land. 

The Supernova    Shooting Comets  The Black Hole
